about2: My name is Tracy Bertrim (she/her), and I am a Registered Psychotherapist in good standing with the College of Registered Psychotherapists of Ontario (CRPO). I have over seven years of clinical experience working with a broad range of clientele with various needs and concerns.
about3: I seek to provide a safe environment for clients to explore their thoughts and feelings without the fear of judgment. In my experience, psychotherapy works well when a collaborative approach is taken between the client and the therapist, in which we work together to establish therapy goals and engage in dialogue to determine the most appropriate resolution.
about4: I primarily work from Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and Cognitive Processing Therapy frameworks. However, I understand and value the uniqueness of each client and their story, so I also draw from other approaches, including Dialectical Behavioral Therapy, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, and Narrative Therapy, to provide a personalized treatment plan.
about5: I completed my Master of Arts Degree in Counselling and Spirituality from Saint Paul University in Ottawa, and I hold a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Psychology and Sociology.
about6: Continuing education and training is important to me, as this allows me to better understand my clientsâ€™ needs and provide safe and effective treatment.  I have completed specified training in areas including trauma-focused therapies, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, clinical supervision, and anxiety.
